TextView.android:text: \t\t\t\t\tA typhoon is a type of large storm system having a circular or spiral system of violent winds, typically hundreds of kilometers or miles in diameter. The winds spiral around a region of low atmospheric pressure. Typhoon is the name of these storms that occur in the Western Pacific.
HOW TO PREPARE FOR A TYPHOON?

\t\t\t\t\tThe Philippines is not unfamiliar to natural disasters and calamities that strike our country year after year. According to the United Nations, it is the third most disaster-prone country globally. Over the last decade, several deadly typhoons including Pablo (Bopha), Frank (Fengshen), and Reming (Durian) were experienced. In 2013, Typhoon Yolanda (international name Haiyan) was one of the strongest tropical cyclones to hit the Philippines. It caused massive destruction to properties and resulted in a high death toll in many parts of the country.
